nodes.bodyText: binding to a well known port, intentionally
This will cause the test to be flaky if something else has this port. AvailablePortHelper would help here.
without the bind of the port this will not match when the proxy is restarted
another possibility would be to sub-class the sniSocketFactory and allow the port to be reset as needed, which is the class most under test here and that makes me not a fan of that approach
we elected not to go this way (socket factory)
We should standardize on using NotOnWindowsDockerRule in the SNI tests.
It would be nice to have a comment describing what the string.format() arguments are about.  Otherwise someone working on this in the future will have to do some digging to figure it out.
